DataElement.preferredName: Observation Study Protocol Document Model Code StudyModelType
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Watching something and taking note of what happens.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of data._A style or design of an item.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation._The code that represents the primary strategy for subject identification and follow up.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Observation Study Protocol Document Model Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Watching something and taking note of what happens.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of data._A style or design of an item.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Watching something and taking note of what happens.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of data.

Concepts.definition: Watching something and taking note of what happens.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.
A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.

Property.preferredDefinition: A style or design of an item.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: A style or design of an item.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/22/2021wz: released for UML model cleanup project.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The code that represents the primary strategy for subject identification and follow up.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A group used as a standard of comparison in a control experiment.

Concepts.definition: A group used as a standard of comparison in a control experiment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An uncontrolled observational study containing a detailed report of the diagnosis, treatment, and follow-up of an individual patient. Case reports also contain some demographic information about the patient (for example, age, gender, ethnic origin).

Concepts.definition: An uncontrolled observational study containing a detailed report of the diagnosis, treatment, and follow-up of an individual patient. Case reports also contain some demographic information about the patient (for example, age, gender, ethnic origin).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A research study that compares a particular outcome (such as lung cancer) in groups of individuals who are alike in many ways but differ by a certain characteristic (for example, female nurses who smoke compared with those who do not smoke).

Concepts.definition: A research study that compares a particular outcome (such as lung cancer) in groups of individuals who are alike in many ways but differ by a certain characteristic (for example, female nurses who smoke compared with those who do not smoke).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Multidisciplinary study done at the population level or among the population groups, generally to find the cause, incidence or spread of the disease or to see the response to the treatment, nutrition or environment.

Concepts.definition: Multidisciplinary study done at the population level or among the population groups, generally to find the cause, incidence or spread of the disease or to see the response to the treatment, nutrition or environment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Research conducted on members of families, examining the affects of genetics, the environment, or twin offspring.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted on related or non-related members of families, examining the affects of genetics, the environment, or twin offspring.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of clinical study in which each study subject receives the same series of treatments but in a random order that differs across arms of the study. Each subject serves as their own control in this type of study.

Concepts.definition: A type of clinical study in which each study subject receives the same series of treatments but in a random order that differs across arms of the study. Each subject serves as their own control in this type of study.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 7/22/2021wz: released for UML model cleanup project.
